com.paypal.selion.annotations

Annotation Type MobileTest


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD,TYPE})
public @interface MobileTest
    Interface creates annotation MobileTest and specified parameters
    Annotation @MobileTest will let Grid know to open a session on a mobile device/simulator. This can be used both in the Test method and the Test Class. When used in the class, then all the tests within the class share the same session (Session Sharing)

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String[] additionalCapabilities
      Provide additional capabilities that you may wish to add as a name value pair.
      Class<? extends DefaultCapabilitiesBuilder>[] additionalCapabilitiesBuilders
      Additional DefaultCapabilitiesBuilders that this mobile test should use.
      String appName
      Establish application name to use.
      String appPath
      This parameter represents the fully qualified path of the app that is to be spawned.
      String browserName
      This parameter specifies the name of the browser
      String device
      Establish the type of device to be used (android, iphone, etc).
      String deviceSerial
      Device Serial to be used.
      String deviceType
      Establish the type of device to be used (Nexus5, Iphone5s, etc).
      String language
      Establish the application's language that is to be used.
      String locale
      Establish the application's locale that is to be used.
      String mobileNodeType
      This parameter specifies to execute mobile test cases using respective mobile driver.

    • Element Detail

      • appName

        public abstract String appName
        Establish application name to use. This is mandatory for all defaults apps. Example 
         @Test()
 @MobileTest(appName = "Safari")
 public void webtest2() {
     Grid.open("http://paypal.com");
 }
        App version can be specified as part of the appName as: 
         appName = "Safari:7.0"
        Default:
        ""

      • device

        public abstract String device
        Establish the type of device to be used (android, iphone, etc). No default. Platform version can be specified as part of the device as: 
         device = "iphone:7.1"
        Default:
        ""

      • language

        public abstract String language
        Establish the application's language that is to be used. For example; en for English. Defaults to the language chosen by Selendroid / ios-driver / Appium
        Default:
        ""

      • locale

        public abstract String locale
        Establish the application's locale that is to be used. For example; en_US for US English. Defaults to the locale chosen by Selendroid / ios-driver / Appium
        Default:
        ""

      • deviceSerial

        public abstract String deviceSerial
        Device Serial to be used. Defaults to the device/emulator chosen by Selendroid / ios-driver / Appium
        Default:
        ""

      • deviceType

        public abstract String deviceType
        Establish the type of device to be used (Nexus5, Iphone5s, etc). Defaults to the device/emulator chosen by Selendroid / ios-driver / Appium
        Default:
        ""

      • additionalCapabilities

        public abstract String[] additionalCapabilities
        Provide additional capabilities that you may wish to add as a name value pair. Values of true or false will be treated as Boolean capabilities unless you surround the value with ' 
          @Test
  @MobileTest(additionalCapabilities={"key1:value1","key2:value2"})
 public void testMethod(){
     // flow
 }
        Default:
        {}

      • additionalCapabilitiesBuilders

        public abstract Class<? extends DefaultCapabilitiesBuilder>[] additionalCapabilitiesBuilders
        Additional DefaultCapabilitiesBuilders that this mobile test should use. Capabilities which are constructed this way are merged with the results of any/all globally applicable capability builders.
        Default:
        {}

      • appPath

        public abstract String appPath
        This parameter represents the fully qualified path of the app that is to be spawned. For app exist in the local disk this should be an absolute path, for app exist in the remote location it should be http URL and for app exist in sauce cloud it can be sauce storage "sauce-storage:testApp.apk". This is mandatory for installable apps running on Appium. appPath cannot be used along with the appName. 
          for app in local disk it can be like appPath = C:\\test\\testApp.apk;
 or for app in http location it can be like appPath = http://server/downloads/testApp.apk
 or for app in sauce cloud it can be like appPath = sauce-storage:testApp.zip
        Default:
        ""

      • mobileNodeType

        public abstract String mobileNodeType
        This parameter specifies to execute mobile test cases using respective mobile driver.
        Default:
        ""

      • browserName

        public abstract String browserName
        This parameter specifies the name of the browser
        Default:
        ""
